name: The dolphin Constellation
description: This Constellation echoes representations of dolphins across screen media.

key_work.title: Jupiter and Mars
key_work.brief_description: Two dolphins are on a quest to save the planet after catastrophic sea-level rise due to climate change. Guided by a unique ‘echo-location’ game mechanic based on the sonar abilities of dolphins, players navigate sunken landmarks and vast oceans.

constellations_other.description: Connections between people, animals and the environment in sci-fi stories, videogames, art and film.

start.title: Flipper
start.brief_description: Flipper,/i>, from Ivan Tors Films in association with Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer Television, is an American television program first broadcast on NBC from September 19, 1964, until April 15, 1967.

constellations_other.name: The dolphin Constellation

end.title: The Cove
end.creator_credit: Charles Hambleton, Fisher Stevens, Olivia Ahnemann, Paula DuPré Pesmen and Danny Wagner
end.brief_description: The Cove tells the amazing true story of how an elite team of individuals, films makers and free divers embarked on a covert mission to penetrate the hidden cove in Japan, shining light on a dark and deadly secret. The shocking discoveries were only the tip of the iceberg.

constellations_other.name: The dolphin Constellation
constellations_other.description: This Constellation echoes representations of dolphins across screen media.

links.description: Sadly the idyllic nature of Flipper didn’t translate to real life. Trainer Ric O’Barry became an activist after one of the dolphins died in his arms. He was one of the main protagonists of award-winning documentary The Cove, which uncovered Japanese dolphin hunting practices.

start.title: Flipper
start.brief_description: Flipper,/i>, from Ivan Tors Films in association with Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer Television, is an American television program first broadcast on NBC from September 19, 1964, until April 15, 1967.

end.title: Flipper
end.brief_description: Flipper is an American revival television series of the original 1964 Flipper television series. The first two seasons aired in first-run syndication; seasons 3 and 4 aired on the PAX network.

constellations_other.name: The dolphin Constellation
constellations_other.description: This Constellation echoes representations of dolphins across screen media.

links.description: The series received a reboot in 1995, which was largely filmed in the Gold Coast, Australia, and was one of the earliest roles for actor Jessica Alba.

end.title: Flipper
end.brief_description: Flipper,/i>, from Ivan Tors Films in association with Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer Television, is an American television program first broadcast on NBC from September 19, 1964, until April 15, 1967.

constellations_other.name: The dolphin Constellation
constellations_other.description: This Constellation echoes representations of dolphins across screen media.

links.description: Jupiter & Mars tells the story of two dolphins who inhabit the planet after humans have gone extinct. This is in stark contrast to Flipper, the heartwarming series about a boy and his dolphin friend.

start.title: Ecco the Dolphin
start.brief_description: Life was an adventure for Ecco, the young dolphin. The ocean seemed endless with rolling breakers to race through! At high speed Ecco could burst through the waves leaping through the air – almost flying! Until one day, all of that changed. A freak whirlpool of air and water tore the life from Ecco’s home leaving Ecco all alone. Now he must fight to stay alive, while traversing the vast ocean in search of clues that will help him save his family and return them to the bay.

constellations_other.name: The dolphin Constellation
constellations_other.description: This Constellation echoes representations of dolphins across screen media.

end.title: ECCOS
end.brief_description:
Andrew Norman Wilson is the mastermind behind “ECCOS” — a “six-hour meditation video” featuring slowed-down footage of a gamer beating Ecco the Dolphin on Sega Genesis. Wilson produced the work from an 80-minute clip, to which he added echo filters for both audio and video tracks. The result is nothing short of haunting — a swirling, psychedelic, and slightly ominous collection of pixelated creatures and seascapes, scored to a persistent low hum.

ECCOS is just one part of Wilson’s “Center for Wave Change” — a proposed “experimental philosophical space that focuses on the phenomena of waves.”

Amar Toor, The Verge, 24/05/12

constellations_other.name: The dolphin Constellation
constellations_other.description: This Constellation echoes representations of dolphins across screen media.

links.description: ECCOS is a six hour video installation work that utilises slowed down footage from Ecco the Dolphin to create a hypnotic and surreal visual experience.

links.description: Arguably the most famous game to feature a dolphin is the Sega classic Ecco the Dolphin, which after its initial ocean levels told an increasingly strange tale about alien invasion.
